grammarNote.title: ている: Ongoing States
grammarNote.explanation:
て-form + いる describes a state. It has two faces.

The Rolling Camera — action in progress. When ムーミン says 動いている, look at the illustration: the plant is actively curling. The camera catches an action mid-way.

The Aftermath — result still visible. 茸が落ちている — the mushroom is not falling now. It already fell, and there it sits. The camera shows what remains after a change.

変わっている — this place HAS changed (and still shows it). Re-read and sort: is each ている a rolling camera or an aftermath?

vocabulary.meaning: certain, sure; if I remember right
